plugins.name: Change Image in Instance
plugins.description:
Change images in instances without detaching them.


Super easy to use

  1. Select image layer in instance
  2. Hold "Shift⇧" on windows or "Command ⌘" on Mac
  3. Select the image you want to insert into the instance.
  4. Run "Change Image in Instance"!!

That's it!!


Tips:

Works best if image sizes are same,

if not

  1. mask input image with shape (of same dimensions) of target image.
  2. Copy masked image as PNG by "⌘ Command + ⇧Shift + C" for mac or "Control + ⇧Shift + C" for windows.
  3. Use the PNG version of the mask and run the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Change your place holder image in component instances without having to detach your component.

plugins.name: Photo Gradient
plugins.description:
Create stunning gradients either by hand or by using the colors from an image. Photo gradient makes it easy to grab the colors of a photo and turn it into a mesh gradient to use in your designs.


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Either upload/paste an image after hitting image icon
  3. OR select a frame/image with the target icon to use something already on your canvas
  4. Adjust the color placement
  5. Then play with the noise, warp, and color placements.


I was tired of gradient tools that weren't fun to use so I built one that others can use for free.


It's also available on the web at photogradient.com

accepted.name: Daniel Destefanis
accepted.description:
Design at @figma
Prev design at @discord

Creator of a few figma plugins, musician,  and most importantly a dad.

plugins.tagline: Create dream-like mesh gradients from images

plugins.name: Vertja
plugins.description:
Vertjaは日本語の縦書きを擬似的に再現し、縦書きの日本語をデザインに取り入れる支援をします ✍️


---


⚠️ このプラグインは通常のテキストを縦書きのレイアウトに変換するものであり、現在のFigma Plugin APIの仕様上、字形を縦書きに適した物に変換することはできません。


そのため、字形を変換するには手動でOpenTypeフォントの機能を有効化します。


句読点などの向きを縦書きに変換するには "Letterforms > Vertical alternates" を有効にし、アルファベットや半角記号が含まれる文字を縦書きにする場合は "Horizontal spacing > Full widths" を有効にしてください。


詳しくはFigmaのドキュメント、 OpenType機能を使用する をご覧ください。


---

plugins.name: Paddi
plugins.description:
❖ OVERVIEW
Paddi helps you to set paddings for a Group, a Frame, or a Component. When you specify the padding values in the component name you can change the elements inside the component and apply the paddings in one click. The component will automatically resize itself so that it surrounds all other elements within the component according to padding values.

Specify the padding values within the component group or frame name. E.g. button [12 24]. The format of the padding values is in the same order as CSS.

❖ FEATURES
✅ Paddi works with Groups, Frames, Components, Libraries.
✅ Paddi is simple! The only thing you need to do is specify the paddings in the component name
✅ Recognize components with paddings looking at their names. ⚡️ It works the same as in CSS.
✅ Paddi is flexible. No limitation there, set the same padding for all sides [12] or different for each one [12 24 14 32].
✅ Paddi uses a base element as a parent and calculates paddings from it.
✅ Speed up your workflow! You don’t need to open plugin settings all the time you need to update paddings. You only need to rename the component and run the Paddi.
✅ Natural master & instance behavior. If you change master component paddings, you don’t need to do anything else to update instances, Paddi will update all instances automatically.
✅ Paddi works with libraries. Create a master component in your library file and apply the padding for all its instances in any project file. ⚠️ If you change padding for the master component in the library you will have to update all instances in the other files manually.

❖ PADDINGS
Padding values sets by clockwise from top to left sides. It works the same as in CSS. Examples:
- [12] - padding for all sides - 12px
- [12 24] - top&bottom - 12px, right&left - 24 px
- [12 24 32] - top - 12px, right&left - 24px, bottom - 32px
- [12 24 32 16] - top - 12px, right - 24px, bottom - 32px, left - 16px

❖ FORMATS
We recommend to use space for separating padding values to keep it simple, however, you can use a comma as well. Examples:
- [12 24]
- [12, 24, 24, 12]

❖ SET PADDINGS FOR A GROUP
1. Create a rectangle. This element will be the base of the component
2. Put some text or another shape inside the rectangle
3. Group these elements
4. Select the Group and whether rename the Group by adding e.g. [16 32] at the end of the name or just run Paddi to apply the default values - [12 24]
5. Change text or resize elements inside the Group
6. Select the Group and run Paddi again to apply the paddings

❖ SET PADDINGS FOR A FRAME
1. Write some text or create a shape
2. Wrap it with a Frame
3. ⚠️ In case you have only one element in the Frame the paddings will calculate from the Frame to its element. ⚠️ In case you have more than 1 element inside the Frame and want to use this Frame as the base you need to wrap all its elements with a Group
4. Select the Frame and whether rename the Frame by adding e.g. [16 32] at the end of the name or just run Paddi to apply the default values - [12 24]
5. Change text or resize elements inside the Frame
6. Select the Frame and run Paddi again to apply the paddings

❖ SET PADDINGS FOR A COMPONENT
1. After you have a Group with some paddings create a master component from it
2. Set constraints for the master component to make sure its instances will responsive correctly. Set Scale for the base and make sure all other elements have Left and Top
3. Change elements and run Paddi. ⚠️ Because you can’t change elements position in an instance you will be able to change only the text elements and then apply the paddings

❖ IGNORE
To ignore some elements in your component, rename the necessary ones with [ignore] or [nopaddi] at the end of its name.

❖ IMPORTANT TO KNOW
⚠️ The lowest element in a group or frame is going to be the base of the component! So don't forget to add a base.
⚠️ The base element in your component will be marked as (base) in the layer name.
⚠️ You can’t change paddings for instance because you can’t change its elements positioning. To handle it, go to the master component or detach the instance.
⚠️ If you want to set a Frame as a base and specify paddings for it, wrap all elements inside this frame in a group to have only one element in the frame and then apply Paddi.

❖ WHERE TO USE
✅ Buttons
✅ Tab items
✅ Navigation items
✅ Dropdown menus
✅ Tags / Pils / Badges
✅ Tooltips / Popovers
✅ Icons
✅ UI Cards
✅ Modal dialogs
✅ Sections
✅ Etc.

❖ SHORTCUT FOR MAC OS
To speed up your workflow add a shortcut to Paddi. It takes a minute to set up but keeps a lot of time later on.
Open System Preferences -> Keyboard -> Shortcuts tab -> App Shortcuts -> Add new:
1. Application: Figma
2. Menu Title: Paddi
3. Keyboard shortcut: cmd+shift+P (You can use your own)

---

😎 MADE BY
Oleksandr Telnov & Mikhail Voloshin at Dumka.io

plugins.name: Zebra Code
plugins.description:
Introducing the Zebra Code plugin for Figma, a powerful tool to generate various types of barcodes and QR codes directly within your Figma projects. Zebra Code supports multiple barcode formats, including QR CODE, UPC A, UPC E, EAN 8, EAN 13, CODE 39, CODE 93, CODE 128, CODABAR, INTERLEAVED 2 5, STANDARD 2 5, MSI CHECKSUM, POSTNET, PLANET, RMS4CC, and KIX.


Tutorial:


  1. Install the Zebra Code plugin in Figma.
  2. Open the plugin in the Figma sidebar by navigating to the Plugins menu and selecting Zebra Code.
  3. Click on a text node in your design or type your desired text into the input field in the plugin UI.
  4. Choose the desired barcode type from the dropdown menu.
  5. Click the "Generate" button to create the barcode. The plugin will generate the barcode and insert it into a frame within your Figma document.
  6. Adjust the position and size of the generated barcode frame as needed.


You can learn more about the API used in this plugin on the following page.

accepted.name: Muhibbudin Suretno
accepted.description: Explore the convergence of imagination and innovation, as we mold your visions into digital masterpieces.

plugins.tagline: Generate various Barcodes and QR with Zebra Code, we supports multiple barcodes formats.

plugins.name: Rapidream - Fully Responsive Code!
plugins.description:
The #1 Figma-to-React plugin.


Use Rapidream with any design! No auto-layout required!


Design for one device size and Rapidream will apply full responsiveness across all devices.


"Is this a bad joke? How is it possible?" you may ask.


No joke. It's possible because Rapidream:


  1. 🧹 First cleans up the design, removing and merging tons of nodes (without changing your copy of course)
  2. 🪺 Figures out the CORRECT nesting and ordering of every element to allow true responsiveness and a clean DOM tree
  3. 🌴 Lets you easily edit the generated DOM tree... while recalculating all the responsive styles in real time!! (we get the code 90% there and make it super easy to finish the last 10%)


Rapidream is best suited for developers working on serious web applications. Landing pages and other design-heavy stuff will also work but is not currently our main focus.


Sign up at app.rapidream.com, and join our (growing) Discord - we'd really love to hear from you!


P.S. The beautiful Figma design above was made by holomusic.co and converted to React by Rapidream.

accepted.name: Yedid Herskovitz
accepted.description: A Figma-to-React tool built BY Front-End devs FOR Front-End devs.

plugins.name: Content Cloud Plugin
plugins.description:
Access assets stored in Box, Dropbox, Google Drive, Google Photos, OneDrive and Lexica.art(a Stable Diffusion search engine) directly.


Watch the demo video


Features:

  • Creative writings with ChatGPT ( Limited time offer: you can use GPT 3.5 Turbo model without API key. For GPT-4 model, please get API key from OpenAI.com )
  • Supported Languages : Deutsch, English, Español, Français, Italiano, Português, 中文(简体/繁體), 日本語, 한국어, العربية
  • Multi-account support allows switching between accounts quickly.
  • Find what you need in intuitive user interface
  • Preview rendition can be placed when asset formats not supported natively in Figma, such as PDF, PSD, INDD files.
  • Download / Upload assets directly from the panel
  • Drag and drop
  • Preview multiple formats of assets directly from the panel , PSD , audio ,video...
  • Content Cloud Plugin connects cloud service (Box, Dropbox, Google Drive, Google Photos...) DIRECTLY instead of through API proxy service, which means it will never intercept any request/response between user and cloud service.



For any Content Cloud or DAM provider that would like to be integrated into this plugin, please contact us. An in-house standalone plugin can be implemented if required.


If you encounter any issue , please contact us by email support@cc-plugin.com or create a support ticket , we will do our best to assist you.

  • Plugin for Adobe application is available on Adobe Creative marketplace

plugins.name: Figma Asteroids
plugins.description:
Play Asteroids in Figma with friends! 🚀


To create a game, run this Plugin.


To join a game, run the Plugin while another game is running. The Plugin will automatically find and join a game if one exists in the same Figma file.


Cooperative game

Shoot down the asteroids with friends! You can copy+paste asteroids to increase difficulty. Try out these level ideas:

Level 1 (easy): 6 asteroids per player

Level 2 (medium): 10 asteroids per player

Level 3 (hard): 15 asteroids per player


Competitive game

Play multiplayer spaceship combat!

  1. Run Plugin
  2. Select all asteroids and delete them via Layers Panel
  3. Let players join game and spread out

Battle! Last team standing wins


Create custom worlds

To create your own worlds, create a Frame and place asteroids as direct children. When the first player goes to run the Plugin, if they have a Frame selected, the Plugin will run using that Frame instead of generating the default world


Get creative with your asteroid designs. Anything that's a direct child of the world is considered an asteroid (collision detection is done assuming all objects are circles, so you'll want to make them roughly circular)

plugins.name: Missing Library Usage Finder
plugins.description:
Enter the name of the Component Instance or Style you want to look for and the plugin will search for it across all pages, resulting in a list of all finds that allows you to go to the finds and/or detach them individually.


Use Case 1: Remove missing libraries

  • View missing libraries via Assets > Library (Book Icon). You'll see Includes X missing libraries at the bottom when you have missing libraries, click it to view the components and styles in use from missing libraries. 
  • Open the Missing Library Usage Finder plugin, enter the names of the styles you want to search for, separated by line-breaks.
  • Press Search, note that this might take a while for larger design files.
  • If the plugin finds uses of the styles or components they get listed below and you can navigate to the find and/or unlink/detach it directly.


Use Case 2: Unlink unwanted library

  • Open unwanted library, e.g. via Assets > Library (Book Icon), then hover over the library name and click Open File. 
  • Once in the unwanted library open the Library Style Detail Extractor plugin and click Extract Names, and then Copy Names to Clipboard. 
  • Go back to the initial design file, open the Missing Library Usage Finder plugin
  • Paste the copied names and click Search. Note that this might take a while for larger design files.
  • If the plugin finds uses of the styles or components they get listed below and you can navigate to the find and/or unlink/detach it directly.


Plugin Source Code

This plugin is part of Radius, Rangle.io's Design System Accelerator.

You can find the source code on Github.

Use Case 2: Unlink unwanted library

  • Open unwanted library, e.g. via Assets > Library (Book Icon), then hover over the library name and click Open File. 
  • Once in the unwanted library open the Library Style Detail Extractor plugin and click Extract Names, and then Copy Names to Clipboard. 
  • Go back to the initial design file, open the Missing Library Usage Finder plugin
  • Paste the copied names and click Search. Note that this might take a while for larger design files.
  • If the plugin finds uses of the styles or components they get listed below and you can navigate to the find and/or unlink/detach it directly.


Plugin Source Code

This plugin is part of Radius, Rangle.io's Design System Accelerator.

You can find the source code on Github.

plugins.name: Multilingual Font Mixer 多语言字体混排
plugins.description:
Now you can mix multilingual text, styled with the fonts of your choice, with one click!


Figma doesn’t provide any function that replicates font stacks, so it’s very time-consuming for the designer to work with multilingual text, when you want to set up different fonts for different languages. We are a design agency in Shanghai, China, called Digital Creative, and we created this Figma plugin to help you gain more control over your typography, making it look better while minimal effort is needed! Simply set up the font styles (plus the font color, opacity, and weight) you want for different languages, and with one click, they will be applied to all the text in one or multiple groups that you’ve selected.


到目前为止，Figma 始终缺失与 CSS font stacks 特性类似的字体自动适配功能，所以当设计师需要把同一页面上的不同语言文本分别设置为不同字体的时候便会非常费时费力。我们是一家位于中国上海的设计机构 —— Digital Creative，我们设计了这款多语言字体混排插件。有了这款插件，您只要在操作框内设置好各语言对应的字体（更可调节字重、字体颜色、字体透明度）即可一键应用至一个或多个文本框内！您不再需要因为繁琐的操作而妥协于使用单一字体，以及不再困扰于系统自带的中文字体选择少、中文字体配套的数字和英文字符设计不好看等问题。


Highlighted Features 

功能特点


  • One-click to apply mixed fonts (as well as font color, opacity, and weight) to different content types (languages & digits).
  • Autocompletion to suggest fonts quickly when typing in font names.
  • Ability to range select groups on the frame to apply the font setup to all the text selected.
  • Currently supports 6 languages, including English, Chinese, Portuguese, Japanese, Russian, Korean， and Thai. 


  • 一键针对不同文本类型（例：中文/英文/数字）进行不同的字体应用（更可调节字重、字体颜色、字体透明度）。
  • 支持快速字体搜索， 自动关出现联字体。
  • 支持将同一设定一键应用到多个不同的图层/文本框。
  • 文本匹配支持 6 种语言（英语、中文、葡萄牙语、日语、俄语、韩语、泰语）及内容类型（数字等）。


How to Use

使用方法


  1. Install Figma-plugin-font-mixer into your Figma.
  2. Select your preferred font, font-weight, color, and opacity, for each language & digits.
  3. Select a node or range select nodes that contain editable text, and click the apply button to apply all the selected font styles to the corresponding content types.
  4. Ta-dah! Done.

  

  1. 下载安装 Figma-plugin-font-mixer 到您的 Figma。
  2. 在插件操作框内为不同文本内容（语言和数字）选择您偏好的对应字体，字重，字体颜色，和字体透明度。
  3. 选择一个或多个编辑框，点击应用键，即可按照您刚刚的偏好设置一键应用。
  4. 恭喜你完工！


Feedback

问题反馈


Got a problem? Please submit your feedback here:

在使用过程中遇到了问题？请在这里提交你的反馈：


https://github.com/dcasia/figma-plugin-font-mixer/issues

accepted.name: Ryan Wu
accepted.description: Design engineer

plugins.name: i18n
plugins.description:
No more manual text layer updates. Just drop your i18n JSON file and update text layers automatically.


How it works

  1. Name text layers with a dot-notation expression such as apps.welcome.title
  2. Start the plugin and drop or select your JSON file.
  3. Text layers with names that match what’s in the JSON file will automatically be updated.


The plugin only accepts the following JSON data structure:

{
  "apps": {
    "welcome": {
      "title": "Happy new year 2021",
      "subtitle": "No more manual text layer updates. Sync your design with your i18n automatically.",
      "cta": {
        "hook": "Miso is good for you.",
        "button": "START"
      }
    }
  }
}

plugins.name: Color Kitchen
plugins.description:
Create recipes for working with colors, color variables and styles systematically, directly on the canvas where you can see what's happening.


Demo file


How to

  1. Run Create components to create a page with components needed for the Color Kitchen plugin
  2. Place instances of the Color Kitchen Recipe component on your canvas.
  3. Select a color, color variable or a color style as source by applying it to the first ⚪️ Swatch Layer on the left side.
  4. Change the ⚙️ Modifier components and the modifiers 🎚 Value as you please. You can also detach the recipe to be able to move things around more freely within the recipe. Add as many ⚙️ Modifiers and ⚙️Color Swatches as you want.
  5. Select one or more recipes and Run recipes to see the modifiers changing all the color swatches on their right. Or run all recipes on the page by not selecting anything before running the command.
  6. If you want to link two or more variables or styles create or apply existing variables or styles to one or more ⚪️ Swatch Layers on the right side.


Additional features

  1. Add ⚙️Print instances to the recipe to see color values, contrast ratios, variable and style names or descriptions printed on the canvas.
  2. Change the variant properties of ⚙️Color Swatch layers to override specific color values in styles with multiple fills, effects and gradients. You need to specify which of the effects, fills or color stops in a gradient you want to override by providing the coordinates as a number. 0 is the first fill/effect. In the case of gradients you need to provide two numbers, the number of the fill and the number of the color stop, like that: 0:1


Use cases

  1. Variation: Link multiple variables or styles with varying opacity or luminance to one main variable or style.
  2. Inheritance: I.e. link colors in shadows or gradients to your main color variables or styles.
  3. Exploration: Try different treatments and color models to create palettes.
  4. Documentation & Collaboration: Make color choices traceable and reproducible.
  5. Theming: Make all colors dependent on a few accent colors.


Available color transformations

  1. Brighten/darken
  2. Saturate/desaturate
  3. Channels: Set or modify a value of a single channel (i.e. red or hue or lightness)
  4. Opacity: Set or add to/subtract from opacity
  5. Luminance: Set to make contrasts work
  6. Mix two colors
  7. Blend two colors using different blend modes
  8. Contrast Minimum: Darken or brighten, until the given contrast ratio in relation to a given second color is met. (Ignores opacity)


Sources

  1. Most color functions are using chroma-js, check the docs for more information.
  2. Built with Create Figma Plugin by Yuan Qing Lim
  3. Node Decoder by Gavin Mc Farland was a huge help


Roadmap

  1. Modifiers to work with additional useful color models like HSLuv or Material Designs' HCT
  2. Generate new styles in addition to syncing existing ones
  3. Cooking with noodles: Use prototyping links or maybe FigJam's connectors to connect color swatches
  4. Add support for variables
  5. Additional guidance within the component descriptions.
  6. More comfortable ways to use a color for multiple shadows
  7. Add demo file
  8. Modifiers that ensure a certain contrast threshold minimum against a selected background color.
  9. Add label elements that print color values and style names to the canvas for readability

accepted.name: Richard Bruskowski
accepted.description:
Freelance Designer — 
Visual design, digital products, hi-fi prototypes, design systems, brand design.

plugins.tagline: Create a color system using recipes. With variables and styles, on the canvas, visible to everyone.

  3. Channels: Set or modify a value of a single channel (i.e. red or hue or lightness)
  4. Opacity: Set or add to/subtract from opacity
  5. Luminance: Set to make contrasts work
  6. Mix two colors
  7. Blend two colors using different blend modes
  8. Contrast Minimum: Darken or brighten, until the given contrast ratio in relation to a given second color is met. (Ignores opacity)


Sources

  1. Most color functions are using chroma-js, check the docs for more information.
  2. Built with Create Figma Plugin by Yuan Qing Lim
  3. Node Decoder by Gavin Mc Farland was a huge help


Roadmap

  1. Modifiers to work with additional useful color models like HSLuv or Material Designs' HCT
  2. Generate new styles in addition to syncing existing ones
  3. Cooking with noodles: Use prototyping links or maybe FigJam's connectors to connect color swatches
  4. Add support for variables
  5. Additional guidance within the component descriptions.
  6. More comfortable ways to use a color for multiple shadows
  7. Add demo file
  8. Modifiers that ensure a certain contrast threshold minimum against a selected background color.
  9. Add label elements that print color values and style names to the canvas for readability
58240.release_notes:
UX improvements:
- Make components adapt to different backgrounds by using transparency, blend mode "difference" and a few other adjustments
- Accept various constellations of whitespace in set modifier
58240.tagline: Create a color system using recipes. With variables and styles, on the canvas, visible to everyone.

plugins.name: Text››helper
plugins.description:
Mostly now native in Figma. Find, replace and insert text content and view the current selected character count.


Sometimes you have lots of text that repeats, and it's not part of a component/instance system. When you want to simply and easily replace the contents of each of those, you can quickly grab Text››helper to help you!


There's three main ways to replace something:

  1. Type text into the Find input, type replacement text in the Replace input and press "Find & Replace" (or hit enter) to replace everything that matches
  2. Select a single item to fill the Find input with that text value, type replacement text in the Replace input and press "Find & Replace" (or hit enter) to replace everything that matches
  3. Highlight multiple items, type a value in the Replace input and press "Replace only" (or hit enter) to replace everything within your current selection


You can also insert text before or after your selected strings, great for easily prepending or appending "-light" to your selection. And you can easily see the current selection(s) total character count.

accepted.name: Karl Koch
accepted.description: Currently building DuckDuckGo, Cosmic, Hand››over, and plugins.run.

plugins.name: Line Length
plugins.description:
Set your text layers width by the average number of characters per line!


New feature

With this last update, it is possible to also check the current Line Length of a given text layer! Check the demo: https://twitter.com/marceloblaz/status/1321561732268105729


One of the most useful ways to measure line length is by average characters per line. It's common practice to set the line length between 45–90 characters in order to have a nice reading flow.


With Line Length it will become a lot easier to find that sweet spot that will give your design a fine look and great readability.


This plugin works with mixed font text layers


Give feedback: https://forms.gle/D9UeBjHfYiukFLP89


Made by

Marcelo Brasileiro

accepted.name: Marcelo Brasileiro
accepted.description: I'm a UX designer with frontend coding skills. I'm interested in helping products become more usable, inclusive, desirable and intelligent.

plugins.tagline: Inspect and define line length of your texts easily

plugins.name: 🔥Magi: Find and Replace (Text, Layer, Color, Font, Instance, Missing Font & Component)
plugins.description:
🚀 Welcome to our Magi: Find and Replace! Created originally to help a UX/UI designer easily replace text, this tool now boasts additional functionalities for designers like you! Enjoy seamless text and design management right within Figma.


🔍 Usage:


Targeted Search Scope:

  • Search within the contents of a selected area, or the entire page if no selection is present.


Search Customization:

  • Check "Case Sensitive" to distinguish between uppercase and lowercase letters. 🔠
  • Check "Match Whole Word" for precise matching that excludes partial word matches. 🧐


Replacement Functions:

  • Click "Replace" to update the text of the currently selected object. 🔄
  • Use "Replace All" to update all instances within the selection or across the entire page when no selection exists. 🌐


🆕 New Features:


  • Color, Font, & Instance Finder: Not just for text! Now you can easily find colors, fonts, and instances throughout your document.
  • Select All: Instead of replacing, you can now select all findings with just one click. Perfect for bulk actions or detailed design adjustments. 🎨🔤


🐞 Feel free to report any bugs or suggest features to enhance the tool further.

accepted.description:

plugins.name: Inter Letter Spacing
plugins.description:
This Figma plugin will fix the letter spacing of selected text layers according to the Inter Dynamic Metrics.

Usage:

1. Select one or more text layers.
2. Run Inter Letter Spacing from the Plugins menu.

Any layers that don't use the Inter font will be left unchanged.

plugins.name: IBM Design Icons by Iconduck
plugins.description:
This Figma Plugin powers the IBM Design Icons open source library. It’s an icon library designed for mobile, desktop, web and print.


There are 597 icons included in this icon library, all of which can be searched through and added to your designs.


Popular IBM Design Icons:

  • Button icons
  • Design icons
  • Navigational icons


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any icons
  • Search through them instantly
  • Click any icon to add it your design
  • View search history
  • View embed history


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite IBM Design Icons

accepted.description: 275,000+ open source icons, illustrations, emojis, logos, flags, clipart and graphics. Free to use on personal and commercial projects.
